page.title: 18The Church/Health/Law
page.content: The church in Tollerton was built in 1956 as a church hall.It has since become a church named St Michael and all Angels,at a re-dedication service held in 1979.The name comes from the Michael Chapel which may have existed during the time of Elizabeth 1st. Family Eucharist at 10.30a.m and Evensong at 6.30p.m are held each Sunday.There is no licence for weddings or funerals,only for baptism. The present vicar made new furniture for the church himself as a suprise for the parishioners. There are two doctors working in the area which covers about 70 square miles.There is a receptionist and a cleaner working in the Surgery also.The doctor sees about 44 patients a day. Our local policeman works in six villages. His
